p: The degree of pulmonary fibrosis is positively correlated with the duration of SARS-CoV-1 disease [ 35]. Clinical data have shown that fibrous organization is more common in patients at the late stage than in patients at an early or mid-term stage. Importantly, pulmonary fibrosis was even seen in patients with SARS who had recovered and were discharged from the hospital. In addition, the incidence of pulmonary fibrosis was approximately 21.5% (67/311) in SARS patients who recovered after nine months from discharge from the hospital [ 37, 38].
